intro: Megaclinium flaccidum, commonly known as the flaccid spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves, which help it store water in its native habitat. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically green or yellow, and it produces a milky sap that can be toxic. Megaclinium flaccidum is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
